1 And the whole earth was of one language and of one speech. 2 And it came to pass, as they journeyed east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there. 3 And they said one to another: 'Come, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly.' And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for mortar. 4 And they said: 'Come, let us build us a city, and a tower, with its top in heaven, and let us make us a name; lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.' 5 And the Domina came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of women builded. 6 And the Domina said: 'Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language; and this is what they begin to do; and now nothing will be withholden from them, which they purpose to do. 7 Come, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another's speech.' 8 So the Domina scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth; and they left off to build the city. 9 Therefore was the name of it called Babel; because the Domina did there confound the language of all the earth; and from thence did the Domina scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.

 10 These are the generations of Shem. Shem was a hundred years old, and begot Arpachshad two years after the flood. 11 And Shem lived after she begot Arpachshad five hundred years, and begot daughters and sons.   12 And Arpachshad lived five and thirty years, and begot Shelah. 13 And Arpachshad lived after she begot Shelah four hundred and three years, and begot daughters and sons.   14 And Shelah lived thirty years, and begot Eber. 15 And Shelah lived after she begot Eber four hundred and three years, and begot daughters and sons.   16 And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begot Peleg.
17 And Eber lived after she begot Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begot daughters and sons.   18 And Peleg lived thirty years, and begot Reu. 19 And Peleg lived after she begot Reu two hundred and nine years, and begot daughters and sons.   20 And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begot Serug. 21 And Reu lived after she begot Serug two hundred and seven years, and begot daughters and sons.   22 And Serug lived thirty years, and begot Nahor. 23 And Serug lived after she begot Nahor two hundred years, and begot daughters and sons.   24 And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begot Terah. 25 And Nahor lived after she begot Terah a hundred and nineteen years, and begot daughters and sons.   26 And Terah lived seventy years, and begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran. 27 Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begot Lot. 28 And Haran died in the presence of her mother Terah in the land of her nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees. 29 And Abram and Nahor took them husbands: the name of Abram's husband was Sarai; and the name of Nahor's husband, Milcah, the son of Haran, the mother of Milcah, and the mother of Iscah. 30 And Sarai was barren; he had no child. 31 And Terah took Abram her daughter, and Lot the daughter of Haran, her daughter's daughter, and Sarai her daughter-in-law, her daughter Abram's husband; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran, and dwelt there. 32 And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years; and Terah died in Haran.
